intro: Bilabrella isoantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bilabrella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Bilabrella isoantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
